title: JCCSS
text1: Jeremy Carter's Computer Service and Sales
text2: Buy a new high quality custom Linux or Windows desktop or laptop computer. Full stack development services available as well.

title: Telephone Sound
text1: Fern and Jeremy's band, formed in 2013.
text2: The second album Empty Spaces was released February 2019, and was recorded and produced with Bitwig and Ardour.

title: Defcronyke
text1: Jeremy's solo electronic music project, started in 2006.
text2: Featuring experimental content that isn't suitable for Telephone Sound.

title: PrettyWeird.ca
text1: Unique apparel for all, by Fern Vale Volante, the artist who made the background image on this site.
text2: Fern is the other member of Telephone Sound, and has collaborated on some of the other stuff on this site.

title: Published Technical Writing
text1: Technical writing by Jeremy which has been published somewhere.

title: Hobnob
text1: A set of Open Base and Open View systems for software projects on Linux, Windows, and macOS. Written in Rust and Go. A work in progress.

title: GitHub Artifact
text1: Download links for your GitHub Actions CI/CD build artifacts. A Rust web app that runs in a Docker container.

title: Debian Post-Install Setup
text1: Run this script after installing Debian to automatically set up a few things which people sometimes complain about Debian not doing during its official install process.

title: Plant Monitor
text1: An esp32 plant monitor program for 8 analog moisture sensors, with a wifi client, an sntp client for time synchronization, OTA update support, and a web app for displaying the sensor data in a web browser.

title: DDS Signal Generator GH-CJDS66 Control Software
text1: A cross-platform command line program and library which can control nearly every aspect of an inexpensive Koolertron DDS Signal Generator device, written in the Rust programming language, and published on crates.io.

title: Extreme Rise of the Triad
text1: Unofficial Linux DosBox helper scripts for The Apogee Throwback Pack version on Steam.
text2: Makes LAN gaming, alternate levels, and other things very simple to use without Proton/Wine.

title: Playfair Encryption Cipher Implementation
text1: Encrypt your secrets with an algorithm from the 1850s. It is probably not safe to do so, but fun anyway.
text2: This can be loaded directly from the Wayback machine, and also has a web version.

title: Shipping Canada Post WooCommerce
text1: A free WooCommerce plugin that gives very accurate shipping estimates for Canada Post.
text2: You can use it on your Wordpress. Made by Jeremy and Fern.

title: Go DS Cache
text1: A Google Cloud Platform Go Datatore wrapper library which adds caching to Datastore queries.
text2: Intended for use with App Engine Flexible Environment, Compute Engine, or Kubernetes Engine.

title: Telephone Sound Audio-Reactive Camera Filter
text1: Visualize your environment through sound. Try it on any device with a screen, camera, and microphone attached.
text2: Made with the HTML5 Web Audio API and WebGL.

title: Stacktris
text1: A game that's like Tetris, but opposite.

title: Box Hunter
text1: A game where you have to try to get to the black box without breaking it first.

title: Grid Pattern Maker
text1: For knitting designs or other.
text2: Cross-platform, made with C++, WxWidgets, and SDL2.

title: Audio Visuals
text1: Visualize your music with this HTML5 audio player.
text2: Made with HTML5 Canvas and Web Audio API.

title: Contrarium
text1: Search for the opposite of what you're looking for.

title: Recipes
text1: Cook good food.

title: GitLab.com Profile
text1: Jeremy's GitLab profile page, containing info about the git-based programming projects Jeremy has created, forked, and/or contributed to on GitLab.com.

title: GitHub.com Profile
text1: Jeremy's GitHub profile page, containing info about the git-based programming projects Jeremy has created, forked, and/or contributed to on GitHub.com.
text2: Note that Jeremy is preferring GitLab.com instead lately for any new projects.

title: EternalVoid.net
text1: The source code for this website.

title: Pay Jeremy for Work, Donation, or Other
text1: PayPal: https://paypal.me/defcronyke

title: Contact Info
text1: Jeremy Carter <jeremy@jeremycarter.ca>
